comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Something I only learned recently - this first bridge collapsed in 1899 while they were building the second one.  See

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/7405443204/]

So 1899 latest date ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The first bridge was built in 1861 to service the abattoirs (see note) which were there first. Read all about it - SMH 22/10/1860 p.5 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13047525 . State Library NSW has a print which it catalogues as "ca.1870s" - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=412114 There are several other 1870s photos of the bridge in the State Library which seem to show similar building development as this photo. Wikipedia article on Glebe Island - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glebe_Island#Abattoirs_and_bridges

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: No way is this the first glebe island bridge.   it is too long.   It is probably the old gladesville bridge

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Great work in finding that print of this photo at the State Library. Someone needs to tell the DoS they have the opening date of the first bridge a few years too early on their Glebe Island Bridge entry - dictionaryofsydney.org/entry/glebe_island_bridge

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Good luck communicating with the DoS!  You might have more patience and tact than I do!

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: DoS are mostly volunteers and had their funding slashed, better to contact Mark Dunn Mark and Laila have a show called "Scratching Sydney's Surface" for FBi Radio 94.5 on Friday mornings at 8.15am scratchingsydneyssurface.wordpress.com/
